intro: Bulbostylis mahafalensis, commonly known as the Mahafal sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flower spikes that are typically green or brown in color. It thrives in wet or marshy habitats and is often found in swampy areas or along the edges of water bodies. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
